intro: Sphaeralcea plicata, commonly known as the pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, silver-gray leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sphaeralcea plicata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
